Overload.descr: This function will send a coloured message to a player
This function will send a coloured message (with alpha) to a player
This function will send a coloured message to every player in the server.
This function will send a coloured message (with alpha) to every player in the server.
This function will send a big message on the screen to a player.
This function will send a big message on the screen to a player. type=1
This function will send a big message on the screen to every player.
This function will send a big message on the screen to every player. type=1
This function shut down the server.
This function will set the server name.
This function will set the max players limit.
This function will set the server password.
This function will set the gamemode name to be shown in the client browser.
This function will set the timerate of the game.
This function will set the game hour.
This function sets the game minutes.
The function will set the game time int hour - The hour of the game (from 00 to 23) int minute - The minute of the game (from 00 to 59)
This function will set the weather of the game. int weather - The weather id to be set
This function will set the gravity of the game. float gravity - The gravity of the game (default is 0.008)
This function will set the speed of the game. float speed - The speed of the game (default is 1)
This function will set the water level of the game. float waterlevel - The water level of the game (default is 6)
This function will set the maximum height. float height - The maximum height
This function will get the server name.
This function will get max players limit.
This function will get the server password.
This function will get the game mode name shown in the client browser.
This function will get the timerate of the game.
This function will get the hour of the game.
This function will get the minute of the game.
This function will get the weather ID of the game.
This function will get the gravity of the game.
This function will get the speed of the game.
This function will get the water level of the game.
This function will get the max height.
This function will toggle the frame limiter sync. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the frame limiter bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the taxi boost jump ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle driving on water. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the frame limiter sync. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle friendly fire ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the driveby ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the perfect handling ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the flying cars ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the jump switch ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the ability to see other players on the radar. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will set the player's tag visible to only his/her team. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the stunt bike ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the shoot in air ability. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the player nametags on or off. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle the join messages on or off. bool toggle - true or false.
This function will toggle death messages on or off. bool toggle - true or false.
This will enable/disable wall glitch bool toggle - true or false.
bool toggle - true or false.
bool toggle - true or false.
This function will return the current status of the frame limiter sync ability.
This function will return the current status of the frame limiter changing ability.
This function will return the current status of the taxi boost jump ability.
This function will return the current status of the drive on water ability.
This function will return the current status of the fast switch ability.
This function will return the current status of the friendly fire ability.
This function will return the current status of the driveby ability.
This function will return the current status of the perfect handling ability.
This function will return the current status of the flying cars ability.
This function will return the current status of the jump switch ability.
This function will return the current status of the players' radarblips.
This function will return the current status of showing markers to only team members.

This function will return the status of wall glitch

This function will add a online radio to vehicle's radio. int radioId - The radio id. string radioName - The radio name. string radioURL - The online radio URL. bool canSelect - Show the radio stream on vehicle's radio list.
This function will add a online radio to vehicle's radio. string radioName - The radio name. string radioURL - The online radio URL. bool canSelect - Show the radio stream on vehicle's radio list.
This function will destroy a radio stream. int radioId - The radio ID.

This function will create a map icon on the radar. int world - The world ID Vector pos - The position of the marker to be created int scale - The marker's size RGBA color - The marker's color int SpriteId - The ID of custom map icon
This function will destroy a created Marker. int markerId - The ID of the created Marker, which is the value returned by CreateMarker

This function will create an explosion at the given location. int world - The world ID int type - The Explosion Types Vector pos - The position of the explosion to be created int playerCaused - the ID of the player to blame the explosion on, or -1 for no player bool onGround - whether explosion happens on ground

This function will create an explosion at the given location (x, y, z) int world - The world ID int type - The Explosion Types float x - The x co-ordinate of the position of the explosion to be created float y - The y co-ordinate of the position of the explosion float z - The z co-ordinate of the position of the explosion int playerCaused - the ID of the player to blame the explosion on, or -1 for no player bool onGround - whether explosion happens on ground
This function will play a sound at a certain position. int world - The world ID int sound - The sound ID Vector pos - The position of the sound to be played at

This function will play a sound at a certain position (x, y, z) int world - The world ID int sound - The sound ID float x - The x co-ordinate of the position of the sound to be played at float y - The y co-ordinate of the position of the sound to be played at float z - The z co-ordinate of the position of the sound to be played at
This Function will Play Sounds for any specific World int world - The world ID. int sound - The sound ID.
This function will enable/disable use of classes bool toUse - true or false

Adds a class to select. int team - team id RGB color - Color int skin - Skin id Vector spawnPos - Position of the player when spawned float spawnAngle - Angle of the player when spawned int wep1 - First weapon of the player int ammo1 - Ammo of the first weapon int wep2 - Second weapon of the player int ammo2 - Ammo of the second weapon int wep3 - Third weapon of the player int ammo3 - Ammo of the third weapon
This function set the camera pos. Vector pos - The position of the camera.

This function set the camera position(x, y, z). float x - x coordinate of the position of the camera float y - y coordinate of the position of the camera float z- z coordinate of the position of the camera
This function will ban an IP from the server. string ip - This is the IP address to be banned
This function will unban an IP from the server. string ip - The IP to be unbanned
This function will check if an IP is banned from the server. string ip - The IP to be checked

This function creates a checkpoint. In racing, checkpoints are used. CPlayer player| null - The player to stream this checkpoint to. If the variable is null, it will be shown to everyone int world - The world id bool isSphere - 'true' for is Sphere and 'false' for not(cylinder) Vector pos - The checkpoint position ARGB color - The checkpoint color float radius - The radius of the checkoint

This function will create a vehicle. int model - The model ID of the vehicle. Vector pos - The position of the vehicle. float angle - The rotation angle of the vehicle. int col1 - The Color1 of the vehicle. int col2 - The Color2 of the vehicle.

This function will create a vehicle( in a world ) int model - The model ID of the vehicle. int world - The world of the vehicle. Vector pos - The position of the vehicle. float angle - The rotation angle of the vehicle. int col1 - The Color1 of the vehicle. int col2 - The Color2 of the vehicle.

This function will create a vehicle( in a world and co-ordinates x, y, z ) int model - The model ID of the vehicle. int world - The world of the vehicle. float x - The x position of the vehicle. float y - The y position of the vehicle. float z - The z position of the vehicle. float angle - The rotation angle of the vehicle. int col1 - The Color1 of the vehicle. int col2 - The Color2 of the vehicle.
This function will create a pickup. int model - The model of pickup. Vector pos - The pos of pickup.

This function will create a pickup ( world, quantity, alpha , isAuto ) int model - The model of pickup. int world - The world of pickup. int quantity - The quantity of pickup. Vector pos - The pos of pickup. int alpha - The alpha of pickup. bool isAuto - (Is auto respawn?)

This function will create a pickup in a world with location given as x, y, z int model - The model of pickup. int world - The world of pickup. int quantity - The quantity of pickup. float x - The x pos of pickup. float y - The y pos of pickup. float z - The z pos of pickup. int alpha - The alpha of pickup. bool isAuto - (Is auto respawn?)
This function will create an object. int model - The object model id int world - The world id Vector pos - The object pos int alpha - The object alpha

This function will create an object at (x, y, z) int model - The object model id. int world - The world id. float x - The x pos of the object. float y - The y pos of the object. float z - The z pos of the object. int alpha - The object alpha.
This function finds a pickup with given ID and returns its instance. int id - The ID of the pickup to find
This function finds an object with g ID and returns its instance int id - The ID of the object to find Returns null if the object with the specified id does not exist.
This function retrieve a vehicle object from vehicle's ID. integer id - The vehicle's ID.
This function retrieve a checkpoint from the given id int id - The ID of the Checkpoint to find Returns null if checkpoint with the specified id does not exist.

This function will set the world bounds of the server. float maxX - The X max float minX - The X min float maxY - The Y max float minY - The Y min Example: SetWorldBounds(5000.0, -5000.0, 5000.0, -5000.0);//Default World Bounds; Use this func on onScriptLoad
This function will get the world bounds of the server. Return value: Bounds worldbounds - the bounds

This function will set the appearence of the wasted screen when a player dies. int deathTime - The death time int fadeTime - The fade time float fadeInSpeed - The fade in speed float fadeOutSpeed - The fade out speed RGB colour - The colour int corpseFadeDelay int corpseFadeTime Example: SetWastedSettings( 0, 0, 0, 0, RGB(0,0,0), 0, 0)
This function will return the appearence of the wasted screen when a player dies. Return value: WastedSettings wastedSettings - The wasted settings.
This function will set the /kill command delay. int delay - The delay.
This function will return the /kill command delay.

This function hides a map object already present in game. integer nModelId - The ModelID of object you want to hide from game int x - The object pos x int y - The object pos y int z - The object pos z See also: HideMapObject

This function hides a map object already present in game. integer nModelId - The ModelID of object you want to hide from game float x - The object pos x float y - The object pos y float z - The object pos z Example: HideMapObject(441, -631.9671021, -465.7115479, 9.247497559)

This function will show an object on the map if the map was hidden using HideMapObject or RawHideMapObject int nModelId - The Model ID of the object, must be an integer. float VectorX - The vector x of the hidden object. Should be float. float VectorY - The vector y of the hidden object. Should be float. float VectorZ - The vector z of the hidden object. Should be float.
This function shows all the hidden map objects.
This function will return the current status of the Cinematic Border of any specified player. CPlayer player = Instance of the player. Return value:bool toggled - true or false
This function will return the current status of the Green Scan Lines of any specified player. CPlayer player = Instance of the player. Return value:bool toggled - true or false
This function will return the current status of the White Scan Lines of any specified player. CPlayer player = Instance of the player. Return value:bool toggled - true or false
This function disconnects a client from the server, aka kick a player. CPlayer player - the player you are going to kick.
This function bans any specified player. CPlayer player - the player you are going to ban.
This function will send a simple message to everyone in the server. string message - The message to send
This function will send a simple message to the player specified. string message - The message to send CPlayer player - The player to send the message to
This function will send a simple message to everyone but the player specified. string message - The message to send CPlayer player - The player not to send the message to
This function will send a private message to the player specified. CPlayer player - The player to send the message to string message - The message to send
This function will send a private message to everyone in the server. string message - The message to send

This function will send a fake private message from one player to another. CPlayer playerToFake - The player to send the message as Player playerTo - The player to send the message to string message - The message to send
int weaponID - The ID of the weapon
This function will return the district name of a given position. float x - The x coordinate float y - The y coordinate
This function will return the name of the given skin ID. int skinId - The ID of the skin
This function will get the weapon ID from it's name. string name - The name of the weapon
The function will get the skin ID from it's name. string name - Any string such as "hilary", "tommy", etc
This function will get the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since starting the server.
This function will edit the settings of a weapon. (damage, range, etc) integer weaponID - model ID of weapon integer fieldID - field ID of data you want to edit float value - value to be set
This function will return a data value of a weapon. (damage, range, etc) int weaponID - model ID of weapon int fieldID - field ID of data you want to get
This function will reset the data value of a weapon. (range, damage, etc) int weaponID - model ID of weapon int fieldID - field ID of data you want to reset
This function will check a weapon for changed data values. (damage, range, etc) int weaponID - model ID of weapon int fieldID - field ID of data you want to check for edits (
This function will reset a weapon's settings to the defaults. (damage, range, etc) int weaponID - model ID of weapon
This function will reset settings(damage, range, etc) of all weapon to its defaults.
This function will get the distance from a point to another. float x1 - The X coordinate float y1 - The Y coordinate float x2 - The X coordinate float y2 - The Y coordinate
This function will reload the scripts.
This function will get the vehicle model from the name. string name - The name of the vehicle
This function will get the vehicle name from the given model ID. int model - The model ID of the vehicle
Checks if a given string is a number
This function will return the count of vehicles.
This function will return the count of pickups.
This function will return the current object count.
This function will return the count of players.
This function does not do anything. It only exists for compatibility reasons and will be removed in the future.
This function does not do anything. It only exists for compatibility reasons and will be removed in the future.
This function will return the current status of the DeathMatch ScoreBoard
This function does not do anything. It only exists for compatibility reasons and will be removed in the future.
This function does not do anything. It only exists for compatibility reasons and will be removed in the future.
This function is deprecated. Its use is discouraged as it may be removed in a future update.
This function is deprecated. Its use is discouraged as it may be removed in a future update.
This function is deprecated. Its use is discouraged as it may be removed in a future update.
This function is deprecated. Its use is discouraged as it may be removed in a future update.
This function returns the forced Height of any Vehicle when it is respawned. Return value:float height - the height
This function will set the vehicles forced respawn height in the game. float height - the height
Retrieve a player object from player's name or ID. string name/int ID - The player's name or ID.

This function will trigger any function after an interval string funcName - the function to call when the timer ends (in a string format) float/int time - the time before the function call int numberOfTimesRepeat - how many times to repeat the process (1 just to execute once, 0 to repeat indefinitely) ... - function (func) parameters

InPoly tests if a point lies within a polygon consisting of at least three and up to 128 points. If the given point is inside the polygon, the function returns true. If not, it returns false. If the points given do not form a valid polygon, the function throws an error. This function only uses two-dimensional space. Passing z-coordinates will return undesired output. float testX - the X-coordinate for the test point float testY - the Y-coordinate for the test point float x1, y1, ... - the coordinates of the points of the polygon

InPoly tests if a point lies within a polygon float testX - the X-coordinate for the test point float testY - the Y-coordinate for the test point string points - "x1, y1, ..." - a string of comma-separated coordinates for the points of the polygon. Passing non-numeric values for the coordinates will not fail, but will produce garbage output.

InPoly tests if a point lies within a polygon float testX - the X-coordinate for the test point float testY - the Y-coordinate for the test point array points - [x1, y1, ...] - an array of coordinates for the points of the polygon

BindKey allows the server to be informed when a player presses a key or a combination of up to three keys. bool onKeyDown - This is the bool for the key function to be called once the key is 'pressed' or 'released' int key - The primary key you bind it to, you can get the key codes from here int key2 - The second key that needs to be pressed for this bind, or zero if not needed. int key3 - The third key that needs to be pressed for this bind, or zero if not needed.
int nKeybindId - The key (nKeybindId is the value returned by BindKey) you want to unbind
This function removes all binded server keys.
